abstract: Institutional Shareholder Services, the prominent proxy advisory firm, told clients in a note on Sunday that they should vote against Carl Icahn’s proposal calling for a $50 billion stock buyback.
snippet: Institutional Shareholder Services, the prominent proxy advisory firm, told clients in a note on Sunday that they should vote against Carl Icahn’s proposal calling for a $50 billion stock buyback.
lead_paragraph: Apple gained a notable new ally on Sunday in its attempts to beat back a proposal by Carl C. Icahn calling for a $50 billion stock buyback.

headline.main: I.S.S. Sides With Apple in Battle Against Icahn

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Scott M. Stringer will urge investors to vote against a proposal for a stock buyback worth $50 billion, arguing that Apple’s management should make such decisions itself.
snippet: Scott M. Stringer will urge investors to vote against a proposal for a stock buyback worth $50 billion, arguing that Apple’s management should make such decisions itself.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:54 a.m. | As the activist investor Carl C. Icahn presses Apple for a $50 billion stock buyback, some other major shareholders plan to push back.

headline.main: New York City Comptroller Resists Investor’s Calls for Apple Buyback
headline.print_headline: New York City Comptroller Resists Investor’s Calls for Apple Buyback

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: A confidential email shows a top Chinese insurance regulator directly asked JPMorgan Chase’s chief for a “favor” to hire a young job applicant. | Steven A. Cohen, the founder of SAC Capital Advisors, remains as elusive as ever. | Alibaba seeks control of AutoNavi. | Apple gains an ally in the fight against Carl C. Icahn. | Stealth I.P.O.’s are on the rise.
snippet: A confidential email shows a top Chinese insurance regulator directly asked JPMorgan Chase’s chief for a “favor” to hire a young job applicant. | Steven A. Cohen, the founder of SAC Capital Advisors, remains as elusive as ever. | Alibaba seeks con...
lead_paragraph: CHINESE OFFICIAL MADE JOB PLEA TO JPMORGAN’S CHIEF  |  In yet another potential setback for JPMorgan Chase, a confidential email shows a top Chinese insurance regulator directly asked Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan’s chairman and chief executive, for a “favor” to hire a young job applicant, a family friend of the regulator. Interviews, and the previously unreported email, show that Mr. Dimon met the applicant at a meeting in 2012, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess report in DealBook. The meeting came as JPMorgan was seeking lucrative work from Chinese insurance companies.

headline.main: A Chinese Official’s Job Plea to JPMorgan’s Chief

abstract: The activist investor Carl C. Icahn’s six-month campaign for Apple to increase shareholder payouts ended as other major investors voiced opposition, but Mr. Icahn still claimed a victory of sorts.
snippet: The activist investor Carl C. Icahn’s six-month campaign for Apple to increase shareholder payouts ended as other major investors voiced opposition, but Mr. Icahn still claimed a victory of sorts.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:52 p.m. | After six months of urging Apple to pay out more money to shareholders, the billionaire Carl C. Icahn dropped his effort on Monday.

headline.main: Icahn Ends Call for Apple Stock Buyback
headline.print_headline: Icahn Ends Call for Apple Stock Buyback

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
